text: If the 2nd term of a G.P is \(\frac{8}{9}\) and the 6th term is 4\(\frac{1}{2}\). Find the common ratio.
explanation:
T2 = \(\frac{8}{9}\), T6 = 4\(\frac{1}{2}\)ar = \(\frac{8}{9}\)ar5 = \(\frac{9}{2}\)\(\frac{ar}{ar^5}\) = \(\frac{8}{9}\) x \(\frac{2}{9}\)\(\frac{1}{r^4}\) = \(\frac{16}{81}\)r = \(\sqrt[4]{\frac{18}{16}}\) = \(\frac{3}{2}\)

text: Calculate the perimeter of a sector of a circle of raduis 12cm and angle 60o.
explanation:

text: Evaluate \(\frac{27^\frac{1}{3} - 8^\frac{2}{3}}{16^\frac{2}{4} \times 2}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{27^\frac{1}{3} - 8^\frac{2}{3}}{16^\frac{2}{4} \times 2}\)\(\frac{27^\frac{1}{3} - 8^\frac{2}{3}}{16^\frac{2}{4} \times 2}\) = \(\frac{3\sqrt{27} - 3\sqrt{8}^2}{\sqrt{16} \times 2}\)\(\frac{3 - 4}{4 \times 2}\)= \(\frac{-1}{8}\)

text: OGIVE is constructed using
explanation:
An ogive is constructed using the cumulative frequencies from a frequency distribution table.
Collect Data: Organize your data into a frequency distribution table.
Calculate Cumulative Frequency: Add frequencies cumulatively for each class interval.
Determine Class Boundaries: Identify the upper boundaries of the class intervals.
Plot Points: Plot cumulative frequencies against the upper class boundaries.
Draw the Ogive: Connect the points with a smooth curve, starting from (0, 0).
Label the Axes: Clearly label the x-axis (upper boundaries) and y-axis (cumulative frequency).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
